intro: Rhopalocarpus thouarsianus, commonly known as the Madagascar cypress, is a member of the Cupressaceae family. It is a small evergreen tree or shrub native to Madagascar, characterized by its aromatic, scale-like leaves. The plant produces small, inconspicuous flowers followed by woody cones that contain seeds. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in montane forests. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
